question: The OS acts as a bridge between the user and the _______.
The OS ensures multiple programs can run efficiently through _______.
When you open multiple applications, the OS manages _______ allocation.
The OS uses _______ memory when there is not enough RAM available.
The service that organizes and manages files stored on the computer is called _______ management.
When you connect a printer, the OS installs necessary _______ to communicate with it.
A user needs to enter a password to log into Windows. This is an example of _______.
The OS allows users to interact with the system using either a GUI or _______.
The OS ensures that computers can connect to the internet using _______ services.
If an application stops responding, the OS allows users to _______ it.
Managing hardware devices like keyboards and printers is a function of _______ management.
The OS continuously monitors the system for errors and helps in _______.
An OS that allows multiple applications to run at the same time is known as a _______ system.
A GUI-based OS allows users to interact with the system using _______.
The OS schedules processes based on their priority in _______ management.
